pr_title: chore: Introspect peer IP address for directpath tests

timeline.message: Add peer IP check for directpath tests

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be slightly cleaner to use setInterceptorProvider instead of the configurator
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the pointer. One concern I had of using setInterceptorProvider is, if the existing channel provider already has its interceptor provider, then we would be replacing the existing one with the one we created. It would be good if we could retrieve the existing interceptor provider and add our own interceptor on top of that, but I couldn't find a good way of doing this. WDYT?
replies.author: WeiranFang

replies.bodyText: Thats a fair point. It would be nice if gax had the ability to add an interceptor. I guess leave it as is for now
replies.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: why is this needed? I think it can safely be a local nonatomic variable in the interceptor
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Right, since it's a per-call interceptor, it should be safe to just use a local variable. Thanks for pointing that out
replies.author: WeiranFang

timeline.bodyText: The name & javadoc are a bit misleading: this enforces that the ip is a direct path ip, the recording aspect seems to be a leftover from a previous approach
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Is it safe to throw exceptions here? will grpc cancel the underlying call? will the supplied listener to be notified of the failure?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Yes, it will throw java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.google.api.gax.rpc.CancelledException: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: CANCELLED: Failed to read headers
replies.author: WeiranFang

replies.bodyText:
Good to know that its safe, but the test failure will be hard for someone to track down.
Can you make the message more explicit, something along the lines of:
"Synthetically aborting the current request because it did not adhere to the test environment's requirement for DirectPath. Expected test to access DirectPath via %s, but RPC was destined for %s"
replies.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: why does this have to be atomic?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: I dont think you need capturedCall here, the inner class should be able to access clientCall directly
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText:
I think your parameters are backwards:
Expected test to access DirectPath via %s, but RPC was destined for %s"
so the values should be flipped:
isDirectPathIpv4() ? "ipv4" : "ipv6", remoteAddr.toString()
timeline.author: igorbernstein2
